TopicTitle: The "You know you're playing a lot of KSP when..." thread

Articles.Content:
Lemme fix that one more time:

When you <strike>aerolithohydrobrake</strike> encounter the Kraken in your car.

... when you <strike>aerolithohydrobrakeencounter the Kraken in your car.</strike> fail to load your car because of too many mods...

... when you <strike>aerolithohydrobrakeencounter the Kraken in your car.</strike> fail to load your car because of too many mods...

Lemme fix that for you:

.... When you go stock because the Universe crashed because you had too many mods.

[...]

When you're on a Boeing 737-300 and thinking about asking the Flight Attendants "What is the specific impulse of the engines, the total mass, and the dry mass because I want to blast this thing into space!" errr....... maybe not the best question to ask anymore

[...]

It happened to me, although I don't remember if it was a 737-300 and that I dropped out at the last moment(I was too shy to ask those information).

You know you play too much KSP when you try to fast forward youtube videos with "."

Also when you decide to install that one mod after your 12h nightshift and find yourself playing the game 5 hours after you were supposed to go to sleep.
When you start drafting out rockets and aircraft in Autocad or other software because you've already modeled the basic parts in it.
I lie, cheat, steal, and murder to play KSP! JUST KIDDINGGGG!!!!!!
When a friend describes a problem they have been running into in ksp and you instantly know what was wrong
When you find yourself trying to mod the mods you already have, for personal use... =P

You know you play too much KSP when you turn frustration with a clipped landing leg blowing your prototype up, into a space drive that uses that force to propel itself.

Explosion.

Testing.

Exploitation.

When in a competitive school debate you say 'My oppositions teams argument is just like a mainsail engine, packs some thrust, but has an extremely low ISP leaving it to be useless in most case meanwhile... sorry as I was saying' Oops fail! and yet we won!
When you start thinking of USB ports as docking ports
When you watch the Curiosity Rover Landing and think: "unfair, that crane is not stock"

When I decided I wanted to land and return from Moho for the fun of it and did it on the first try without testing anything.

The interplanetary tug still could have taken me to Jool and back if I wanted. It sits in high Kerbin orbit waiting for my next mission to wherever. Perhaps I should give my guys on laythe some more jet fuel to have fun with..

A few days ago I dreamt about these forums.

Not about KSP, about the forum.

The worst thing is not the dream but the fact that I thought about posting the story on this thread(it's a good sing after all) before thinking that I play too much KSP(is that even possible?)

EDIT: Now, when I think of it I'm somewhat creeped out.

Edited February 24, 2014 by goldenpeach

There are two (well, one and a half) beltways around my city. A friend of mine lives just outside the outer one, I live inside the inner one on the opposite end of town. He just happens to live near point where these two roads are closest. I've started think I'm doing a Hohmann transfer each time I go over to visit.
While driving you keep thinking the tiny dots that are on your front window is Minmus... Then get annoyed when it isn't.
When you see a famous fried chicken restaurant name, and you read "Kerbal Fried Chicken"...
When you think your potted plant is a kerbal.
When you right-click and drag to turn the pages of your Word document...

When you right-click and drag to turn the pages of your Word document...

Heh, actually, I blame Google Reader and Windows 8 for that.

When you think your potted plant is a kerbal.

This plant?
When you search this forum while sitting in the high school, you got me :/ oh, and trying to think words with K.
You look through 700 posts in this thread: P.S. 700th post.
Your at work and you hit F5 to save your word document, and spend a second wondering why it didn't work.

You Know You Play To Much KSP When You Go To Nasa's Site And Check For Jobs And Look At The Moon And Think You Could Totally Go There And Also When You Start Checking The Status Of Every Current Nasa Mission
